messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Tampa
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Tom; I collected and studied early Mino blades especially Kanesada, Kanemoto and Kaneuji. I will be at the show and would like to have a look at this blade
messages.messageBody:
Hi Tom;

I collected and studied early Mino blades especially Kanesada, Kanemoto and Kaneuji.

I will be at the show and would like to have a look at this blade if I may.

John Berta
----- Original Message -----
From: Tom Zogaric
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, February 02, 2006 4:26 PM
Subject: [nihontostudy] Tampa


I will be attending the Tampa showing on Saturday. I am bringing
along a sword identified as " IZUMI (no) KAMI KANESADA " with a date
of August 1506. Perhaps someone will be able to give me some insight
as to the validity of this blade. Looking forward to meeting many of
you in person whom I have only discovered through the e-mails across
the board. It will be nice to put faces to the people who have been
sending out all of that e-mail.
Regards to all,
Tom Zogaric

messages.subject: Tampa
messages.msgSnippet: I will be attending the Tampa showing on Saturday.  I am bringing along a sword identified as  IZUMI (no) KAMI KANESADA   with a date of August 1506.
messages.messageBody:
I will be attending the Tampa showing on Saturday. I am bringing
along a sword identified as " IZUMI (no) KAMI KANESADA " with a date
of August 1506. Perhaps someone will be able to give me some insight
as to the validity of this blade. Looking forward to meeting many of
you in person whom I have only discovered through the e-mails across
the board. It will be nice to put faces to the people who have been
sending out all of that e-mail.
Regards to all,
Tom Zogaric
